src/client/dvdriver.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * Stub driver for development of specific
00003  * personality of an OpenAUC/GDOLMS embedded
00004  * device interface. Uses mddevice.dll/.so
00005  * to communicate with the rest of the system.
00006  * 
00007  * This example is written as a command line
00008  * program but I expect most of the code for
00009  * a production device would be in a DLL.
00010  *
00011  * All of the facilities of the embedded MD
00012  * client are exercised here so it's simply
00013  * a matter of adding specific data feeders
00014  * and command processors.
00015  *
00016  */
00017 
00018 #define DV_DRV
00019 #define DV_DRV_MAIN
00020 
00021 
00022  int nObs,nODEs,nSCPI;
00023 
00024 #include "md_device.h"

00026 using namespace boost::interprocess;
00027 using namespace std;

00031 void signal_handler(int);

00033 
00034 int problem=OK;
00035 
00036 void additionalUserMsgs() {
00037 
00038     // stub to add user error msgs
00039 
00040     mdErrors->additionalUserMsg(1000,"Replace me with your text");
00041 
00042 }
00043 void stubCmdProcessor(char *cmd,char *fullText) {
00044 
00045    int rc = OK; // from a value set in additionalUserMsgs
00046 
00047     // cmd contains the registered command, fullText the complete text of the sent command.
00048     // when done processing, the command processor must use mdCmdResult and set rc if any
00049     // exceptions need to be relayed back to the MD system.
00050    
00051    mdDDAPI->mdCmdResult(rc);
00052 
00053 }
00054 bool regMySCPI() {
00055 
00056   int    rc=OK;
00057 
00058   if (!rc) { rc=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterCommandCallback(stubCmdProcessor,"RST"); nSCPI++; }
00059   // Repeat above for each command this device can handle
00060 
00061   if (rc) mdDDAPI->log->logN(1,"Error registering cmd cb: %s.",mdErrors->what());
00062 
00063   return (rc == OK);
00064 
00065 }
00066 int regMyData() {
00067 
00068   bool doConfTests=false,rules=false; // Set this to true if rule based operation in effect.
00069   mdObservable             *obs=NULL; // i.e. if the MD was started with 'auc-kb' not 'auc-md'.
00070   mdOperationalDataElement *ode=NULL;
00071   int                          rc=OK; 
00072 
00073   // "device" and "_device" are are predefined for every normal device 
00074   // (the MD, CD, and data clients excluded). If the OpenAUC MD server
00075   // is auc-kb then the additional ones below are predefined in the 
00076   // knowledgebase. They can also be defined thru a data client using
00077   // XMLRPC. Attempts to register a data element not predefined for
00078   // the device will fail.
00079   
00080 
00081   if (doConfTests) {
00082 
00083    if (obs=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterObservable("bogus"))
00084    {mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"MD accepted an invalid observation.");
00085     goto done;
00086    }
00087    if (ode=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterODE("_bogus"))
00088    {mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"MD accepted an invalid operational datum.");
00089     goto done;
00090    }
00091    mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"Data Element registration API tested OK.");
00092   
00093   }
00094 
00095   if (!obs && (obs=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterObservable("device")))      {myObs["device"] = obs; nObs++;}
00096   if (rules) {
00097   if  (obs && (obs=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterObservable("pressure")))    {myObs["pressure"] = obs; nObs++;}
00098   if  (obs && (obs=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterObservable("temperature"))) {myObs["temperature"] = obs; nObs++;} 
00099   // Repeat above line for each observation
00100   }
00101   if (!obs) mdDDAPI->log->logN(1,"Error registering observable: %s.",mdErrors->what());
00102   
00103   if (!ode && (ode=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterODE("_device")))            {myODEs["_device"]   = ode; nODEs++;}
00104   if (rules) {
00105   if (!ode && (ode=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterODE("_powered")))           {myODEs["_powered"]  = ode; nODEs++;}
00106   if  (ode && (ode=mdDDAPI->mdRegisterODE("_spinning")))          {myODEs["_spinning"] = ode; nODEs++;}
00107   }
00108   // Repeat above line for each non-observational data element
00109 
00110   if (!ode) mdDDAPI->log->logN(1,"Error registering ODE: %s.",mdErrors->what());
00111 
00112   rc = (ode != NULL && obs != NULL);
00113 
00114   done: return rc;
00115 
00116 }
00117 int 
00118 main(int           const argc, 
00119      const char ** const argv) 
00120 {
00121 #ifndef _WIN32_WINNT
00122     setSignals();
00123     aucDevice();
00124 #endif
00125     mdError stub;
00126     stub.get(&mdErrors);
00127     additionalUserMsgs();
00128     nObs = nODEs = nSCPI = 0;
00129 
00130    // Construct shared memory for data elements produced on this host.
00131    // Provide standard RAII constructor/destructor:
00132 
00133    struct shm_remove 
00134    {
00135      shm_remove()  { shared_memory_object::remove("auc_dv_global"); }
00136      ~shm_remove() { shared_memory_object::remove("auc_dv_global"); }
00137    } remover;
00138 
00139   shared_memory_object shm(create_only, "auc_dv_global", read_write);
00140   shm.truncate(sizeof(auc_dv_global));    
00141   mapped_region dv_telemetry_frame(shm, read_write);
00142   memset(dv_telemetry_frame.get_address(), 0, dv_telemetry_frame.get_size());
00143   gm = (auc_dv_global *)dv_telemetry_frame.get_address();
00144   // Below will segfault if there is a problem so catches are futile.
00145   // Debug by catching any SIGSEGVs in a debugger.
00146   strcpy(gm->id,"auc_dv_global");
00147   strcmp(gm->id,"auc_dv_global"); 
00148 
00149    // Construct the md_device.dll object exactly once in any process.
00150 
00151     mdEmbeddedAPI thisMDEmbedding =
00152     mdEmbeddedAPI( // logPath removed - c:\openauc\logs must pre-exist.
00153    // The host names can be defaulted to their mdcommon.h values by specifying 
00154    // empty strings here, but the ports must be specified, 4242 being the common value
00155    // Values set below are those for the current "staging" environment. 
00156                   // "", "4242", "", "4242" );                // Use defaults
00157                   "67.223.227.29",   "4242",   // md ip,port
00158                   "208.109.106.127", "4242");  // cd "
00159    
00160    /* the MD thread group runs independently of this one
00161       from this point, but in the process context of this
00162       function, anchored to this block context.
00163    */
00164 
00165    thisMDEmbedding.setSingleton(gm);
00166    mdDDAPI = &thisMDEmbedding;
00167 
00168    // Devices are clustered with the CD so it needs to be connected to proceed.
00169 
00170    while (!*mdDDAPI->cdConnected) {
00171      boost::system_time const alarum=boost::get_system_time() + boost::posix_time::seconds(5); // adjust as needed
00172      boost::this_thread::sleep(alarum);
00173    }
00174 
00175    /* The commands and data elements which this device can handle/originate
00176       can be changed in realtime but not at this level of the system. So MD
00177       must know that the device can field the command or data before the 
00178       device registers to do so or the attempt to register will fail.
00179  . */
00180 
00181    mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"Registering data and SCPI for this device.");
00182    if (regMyData() && regMySCPI())
00183         mdDDAPI->mdResume();
00184    else exit(problem);
00185    
00186    /* At this point the device is connected to the system and
00187       registered for the commands and data it can handle. All 
00188       further work will be done by the md_device.dll threads,
00189       the SCPI commands using the registered callbacks and the
00190       dataLayer sending telemetry frames with values collected
00191       from the common system shared memory in which the data
00192       elements have been placed. Updates to the Observables and
00193       ODEs could be done in this thread but it would be
00194       better to do so in another process or processes which get
00195       access to the shared memory and updates it independently of
00196       this process or at least the thread of this block (i.e. 
00197       dvdriver.main (or whatever this source module is transformed
00198       into in an actual device)) context. Any process on the
00199       machine can obtain access to the data elements in the same
00200       way as this one does.
00201 
00202       The shared memory is only defined in the lifetime of this
00203       block so it cannot exit until the md_device.dll interface
00204       is no longer needed.
00205 
00206       Use the maps myObs and myODEs anytime while this process
00207       is active to set values of data elements. Besides the unix
00208       stuff, the command and data element registration and the
00209       process anchoring below can be removed to start a new
00210       stub process which will define DV_DRV but not DV_DRV_MAIN.
00211       The mdDDAPI object should be created with a default
00212       constructor (no parameters) and the setSingleton method
00213       must be executed in order for the new process to have
00214       access to myObs and myODEs. Yield and Resume can be 
00215       executed in any process.
00216       
00217     */
00218 
00219    bool dlt = mdDDAPI->data_layer->joinable(),
00220          tt = mdDDAPI->telemetry->joinable();
00221 
00222    if (dlt && tt)
00223    {
00224        mdDDAPI->log->logN(3,"%d observations, %d operational variables, %d SCPI commands registered with MD",nObs,nODEs,nSCPI);
00225        mdDDAPI->data_layer->join();
00226        mdDDAPI->telemetry->join();
00227    }
00228    else mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"Initialization failed, process ends.");
00229    mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"MD Device Interface EOJ.");
00230 
00231 }
00232 #ifndef _WIN32_WINNT
00233 void setSignals() {
00234 
00235     signal(SIGCHLD,SIG_IGN);            /* ignore child */ 
00236     signal(SIGTSTP,SIG_IGN);            /* ignore tty signals */ 
00237     signal(SIGTTOU,SIG_IGN);            // both input
00238     signal(SIGTTIN,SIG_IGN);            //  and output
00239     signal(SIGSEGV,signal_handler);
00240     signal(SIGUSR1,signal_handler);     // commander log messages
00241     signal(SIGUSR2,signal_handler);     // reserved
00242     signal(SIGHUP,signal_handler);      /* catch hangup signal */
00243     signal(SIGTERM,signal_handler);     /* catch kill signal   */
00244 
00245 }
00246 void signal_handler(int sig)
00247 {
00248    switch(sig) {
00249         case SIGSEGV:
00250                 break;
00251         case SIGUSR1: 
00252                 break;
00253         case SIGUSR2: 
00254                 break;
00255         case SIGHUP:
00256                 mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"hangup signal caught, currently auc-md ignores this.");
00257                 break;
00258         case SIGTERM:
00259                 mdDDAPI->log->logN(0,"terminate signal caught, auc-md will shutdown.");
00260                 exit(0);
00261                 break;
00262    }
00263 }
00264 #endif
